results.title: Denial
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Phillip Crawford
results.brief_description: Kane is a 14-year old with a plan. Using his brother as bait, he steals some money off a man with a model train-set. But the plan goes wrong. If Kane is not careful the things that he wants to keep hidden will be let out. This film deals with the issue of sexual abuse through the eyes of a teenage boy who wants to forget. A very real and powerful portrayl of human nature. (Awards: Winner of the Southern Star Award for Best Film, Winner ATOM Awards 1998 Best Tertiary Short Fiction)

results.title: Denial
results.brief_description: When you’re fourteen and in trouble, confusion builds on confusion. Kane’s secret has become too complicated, too painful, too dangerous, and he can’t begin to stop denying. This award-winning and internationally acclaimed film is a study of some of the difficulties affecting all youth growing up in the 90’s.

results.title: Deng's legacy: China as an economic force
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Richard Hall and New Eagle International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
China’s emergence as a global economic force and dramatic changes within Chinese life are due largely to the policies instituted under Deng Xiaoping. This program examines Deng’s career and the continuing impact of his economic policies. The old style of communism, with its policy of isolation from the West and self-sufficiency, is evolving into a socialist market economy. Joint ventures and foreign investment are becoming popular. The program profiles several such projects and also looks at “special economic zones” such as Hainan which have greater autonomy from the central government. Also looks at some of the problems emerging as a result of rapid change and economic growth, such as prostitution, rural poverty, untempered greed and corruption. Narrated by Joan Chen.

results.title: Demonstration in perception
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: Presents some of the demonstrations in use at Princeton University, USA, for research in perception. Apparatus employed in the demonstrations includes: three chairs; size, brightness apparatus; overlay table; stationary trapezoid; rotation trapezoid; distorted rooms.

results.title: Demons and deities
results.creator_credit: John Darling, John McLean and Bozado
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Bali triptych”.
Balinese religion is an amalgam of the worship of local deities and Hindu and Buddhist beliefs. The Balinese display a strong sense of community co-operation and collective responsibility in their adherence to ancestor worship. This is most apparent in the regularity of their attendance at complex rituals at numerous temples and shrines across the island. This program records and explains the significance of many of the most important ceremonies of the 210 day Balinese calendar, ceremonies which feature sacred dance, frenzied trance states and mass exorcism, animal sacrifice, cock fighting, mock battles and time-consuming preparation of elaborate and beautiful decorations and offerings of food.

results.title: Demon Stalkers for Commodore 64/128
results.creator_credit: Electronic Arts and Micro Forte Studios
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, code wheel, warranty card & manual (paper booklet) in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description:
Demon Stalkers is an action RPG and editor/construction set game. It is similar to Atari’s Gauntlet. The player can choose either the hero, armed with throwing knives, or the heroine, armed with a crossbow who must travel through ninety-nine mazes before meeting the final demon. The game features different enemies as you progress through the mazes, with clues to progression built in. There is also a two-player co-operative mode. The in-built level editor uses pull-down menus and offers a high level of flexibility. As well as creating actual levels, the player can create an integrated storyline and game world, since the in-game text can also be edited.
The game shipped with a Magic Cipher consisting of three cardboard wheels that, when moved to the correct positions, revealed the passwords were needed to access some of the lower levels of the dungeon. Some of the vital text in the cipher is in a tone of blue that could not be photocopied at that point, making the cipher a basic anti-piracy measure.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/demon-stalkers/

Last accessed: 14/04/2021

Original game developed by Micro Forte Studios for Commodore 64 and 128, published in 1987 by Electronic Arts.

results.title: Demon lover diary
results.creator_credit: DeMott, Kreines Films and Joel DeMott
results.brief_description: Demon Lover Diary is a documentary about the making of a low-budget horror film, but beneath the surface of this terse, incisive, cinema-verite study is a sense of real-life horror. DeMott’s boyfriend, Jeff is hired by Don and Jerry to photograph their film, “Demon Lover”. The production becomes a shambles and eventually explodes into violence.

results.title: Demon Christmas in Austria
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Christmas festivities in the small Austrian town of Altenmarkt begin early in December as St. Nicholas visits all the children in the town, accompanied by the Grumpus, the evil spirits of winter and the dark. The celebrations culminate in a parade through the town during which the mischief making Grumpus are driven out by the Perchtens, good spirits who announce the coming of spring.

results.title: Demon and marvels
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Pierre Moretti, Gaston Sarault and Bertrand Langlois
results.brief_description: This film depicts a world where space is geometric, noise is absent and nothing happens until a small white cube comes bumping along, stirring up movement where before there was none. Chased by a wicked demon, the cube symbolizes the inner struggle which goes on inside each one of us: the confrontation, or evasion, of one’s private demons. A film without commentary. (Awards: San Francisco)

results.title: Democratic curriculum
results.creator_credit: Focus Films, Dean Ashden and David Woodgate
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the direction of education in Australia today as it comes to terms with changing society. Looks at schools in Victoria and South Australia and presents the views of educators, parents and children about the best ways educators can meet the needs of individual students. Considers goal based assessment, non sexist curricula and curricula supporting the needs of girls who have not received equal classroom opportunities. Outlines the underlaying principles behind the new ‘democratic curriculum’.

results.description: Provides an overview of the direction of education in Australia today as it comes to terms with changing society. Looks at schools in Victoria and South Australia and presents the views of educators, parents and children about the best ways educators can meet the needs of individual students. Considers goal based assessment, non sexist curricula and curricula supporting the needs of girls who have not received equal classroom opportunities. Outlines the underlaying principles behind the new ‘democratic curriculum’.
